details:
#### Primary Objective:
Retrieve all information related to service delivery performance, operational workflows, resource management, and customer satisfaction to optimize efficiency and quality.

#### Core Information to Retrieve:
-   **Performance Metrics:** Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), Service Level Agreements (SLAs), dashboards, performance scorecards.
-   **Specific KPIs:** First Call Resolution (FCR), Average Handle Time (AHT), Customer Satisfaction (CSAT), Net Promoter Score (NPS), ticket volume, ticket backlog, response time, resolution time.
-   **Process Documents:** Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), workflow diagrams, process maps, incident management protocols, escalation procedures.
-   **Resource Management:** Staffing schedules, shift rotas, workforce management (WFM) reports, capacity planning, skill matrices, team rosters.
-   **Quality & Compliance:** Quality Assurance (QA) reports, call monitoring scores, compliance checklists, audit findings, Root Cause Analysis (RCA) reports.
-   **Customer Interaction Data:** Support tickets, service requests, customer complaint logs, customer feedback summaries.
-   **Financials:** Operational budgets, cost-per-contact or cost-per-ticket analysis, overtime reports, vendor invoices.
-   **Tools & Technology:** System uptime/downtime reports, software license usage, contact center platform reports, knowledge base articles.

#### Information to Ignore (Noise):
-   Sales forecasts and marketing campaign plans.
-   New product development roadmaps and engineering specifications.
-   Company-wide financial statements (e.g., annual reports, shareholder letters).
-   General HR policies not related to team management (e.g., benefits administration, 401k plans).
-   High-level corporate strategy documents and market research reports.
-   Legal contracts unrelated to service vendors or customer SLAs.
-   Marketing collateral and advertising copy.
